terms.title: The CELO Rewards Program lets you earn rewards in CELO for holding a cUSD balance!

howItWorks.title: Here’s how it works:
howItWorks.1: Start by <0>transferring cUSD to your wallet</0> to participate! You can follow these instructions for <1>adding cUSD to a Valora wallet.</1>
howItWorks.2: <0>Confirm your phone number.</0> An easy way to do this is to confirm your phone number with the Valora app by following the onboarding steps in the app!
howItWorks.3: <0>Rewards are calculated at the end of each rewards period (weekly)</0> based on the average cUSD balance you held during the entire rewards period (“balance”)*:
howItWorks.4: <0>Rewards are credited to your CELO balance within 3 days</0> after the end of each rewards period. You can check your CELO balance in Valora by going to the CELO tab in the app Menu.
howItWorks.5: <0>Until March 1st (introduction period), the rewards will be 4x</0>. Join in early to benefit from higher rewards!

tier1.body: Tier 1: Get $0.25 USD in CELO with a minimum average balance of 10 cUSD during the rewards period

tier2.body: Tier 2: Get $1.25 USD in CELO with a minimum average balance of 100 cUSD during the rewards period

tier3.body: Tier 3: Get $2.5 USD in CELO with a minimum average balance of 500 cUSD during the rewards period

moreDetails.title: More details:
moreDetails.1: <0>Make sure to confirm your phone number and have an appropriate balance to receive the rewards.</0> You can <1>confirm your phone number in the Valora app</1> (this is the process when you receive 3 text messages).
moreDetails.2: You do not need to take further action to claim the rewards, as long as you meet the requirements above. Eligibility is based on phone number confirmation and average cUSD balance amount during the rewards period.
moreDetails.3:
The program is expected to run at least until June 1st, 2021 or until funds run out, although reward amounts and program duration may change.
There will be 5 weekly reward periods, followed by 3 monthly reward periods:
moreDetails.3-1: The introductory  period will start on Monday, Jan 25th, 2021 at 20:00 UTC, and end on March 1st, 2021 at 19:59 UTC
moreDetails.4: <0>An account's average cUSD balance during the entire rewards period is calculated by averaging the address' cUSD balance over all blocks validated during the rewards period in the Celo blockchain.</0> For instance, if:
moreDetails.4-1: A rewards period goes from February 1st, 20:00 UTC to February 8th
moreDetails.4-2: You hold 0 cUSD from February 1st, 20:00 UTC to February 4th, 08:00 UTC
moreDetails.4-3: You add 10 cUSD on February 4th, 08:00 UTC (halfway through the rewards period) and keep this balance in your wallet until February 8th, 20:00 UTC
moreDetails.4-4: Your qualifying balance for this rewards period would be of approximately 5 cUSD (depending on rounding and average block time).
moreDetails.5: <0>Rewards will be distributed on a first come, first serve basis</0> (by phone number confirmation date) up to a total limit of 20,000 CELO per calendar month.
moreDetails.5-1: During the introduction period, this total limit will be brought up to 20,000 CELO per week.
moreDetails.6: <0>The price of CELO will be calculated based on the average "Close" price for CELO as indicated on coinmarketcap.com for the earning period.</0>
moreDetails.6-1: For instance, for the first week of February, CELO price will be the sum of the 7 days Close price of CELO on coinmarketcap.com from February 1st, 2021 (included) to February 8th, 2021 (excluded), divided by 7.

celoAndCusd.title: What is CELO and cUSD?
celoAndCusd.1: Celo Dollars, or cUSD is an asset designed for everyday life: people can easily pay, save and send with cUSD to anyone with a phone number, worldwide. cUSD has a stable value that tracks the US Dollar.
celoAndCusd.2: CELO is the core asset used for governance, reserve and staking on the Celo Network. It has a fixed supply and a variable value related, in part, to the total value of stable assets in circulation in the Celo ecosystem.

rewardsTroubleShoot.title: Why did my reward not show up?
rewardsTroubleShoot.description: There are a few possible reasons:
rewardsTroubleShoot.1: <0>The address with the qualifying balance may not have verified their phone number.</0> An easy way to do this is to confirm your phone number with the Valora app by following the onboarding steps in the app!
rewardsTroubleShoot.2: <0>Even if your cUSD balance is currently high enough to qualify for a reward tier, your average cUSD balance over the previous earnings period may not have been</0>, if you added funds after the beginning of the earnings period. For instance, if:
rewardsTroubleShoot.2-1: A rewards period goes from February 1st, 20:00 UTC to February 8th
rewardsTroubleShoot.2-2: You hold 0 cUSD from February 1st, 20:00 UTC to February 4th, 08:00 UTC
rewardsTroubleShoot.2-3: You add 10 cUSD on February 4th, 08:00 UTC (halfway through the rewards period)
rewardsTroubleShoot.2-4: You keep this balance in your wallet until February 8th, 20:00 UTC
rewardsTroubleShoot.2-5: Your qualifying balance for this rewards period would be of approximately 5 cUSD (depending on rounding and average block time).
rewardsTroubleShoot.3: <0>It can take some time to process the rewards and send them.</0> Rewards will usually be processed within 3 days of the end of the earnings period.

notices.title: Important notices:
notices.body:
The reward rate and terms are subject to change over time, and are void where prohibited. Rewards are not guaranteed, may be discontinued at any time, and will be allocated on a best efforts basis. Actual results may vary, based on various factors such as leap years, timing of transfers, rounding, fund exhaustion, and variation in reward rates.

This CELO Rewards Program is the effort of the Celo community with the CELO rewards coming from decentralized Celo Community Fund via a multisig wallet operated by community volunteers (the “Celo Community Volunteers''). Read more about the fund <0>here</0> and if you’d like to join the conversation, join the forum <1>discussion</1>. The Celo Rewards Program is decentralized and is not managed or operated by the Celo Foundation or any of its Alliance for Prosperity members.
